item.title: 交易日：非农数据出乎意料，日元再度走强
item.description: 周三美国就业数据强于预期公布后，华尔街股市震荡，国债收益率攀升，而日元则延续大选后的强势涨势，连续第三日走高。【原文：Wall Street wobbled and Treasury yields rose on Wednesday following the release of stronger-than-expected U.S. jobs data, while Japan's yen extended its strong post-election rally for a third day.】

item.title: 为何日本首相胆大妄为却不敢玩弄日元贬值的风险
item.description: 日本首相高市早苗以压倒性优势赢得选举，为其经济刺激计划注入了新的动力，但日元贬值可能引发的动荡风险，仍是制约其推行低利率政策的重要因素。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's landslide election win has given fresh impetus to her economic stimulus agenda but the risk of destabilising yen declines remains one firm check on her push for low interest rates.】

item.title: 泰勒科技公司因软件支出放缓而下调年度营收预期
item.description: 泰勒科技公司周三公布的2026财年全年营收预期低于华尔街预期，因经济不确定性导致政府机构缩减预算，该软件开发商股价在盘后交易中下跌逾8%。【原文：Tyler Technologies forecast full-year 2026 revenue below Wall Street expectations on Wednesday, as government entities pare back budgets owing to economic uncertainty, sending the software developer's shares down over 8% in extended trading.】

item.title: 摩托罗拉解决方案公司预测全年销售额和利润将超出预期
item.description: 摩托罗拉解决方案公司周三预测全年销售额和利润将超出华尔街预期，押注其公共安全技术业务将受益于持续的政府支出。【原文：Motorola Solutions forecast annual sales and profit above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, betting on its public safety technology business to benefit from sustained government spending.】

item.title: 巴西考虑为对华牛肉出口商设定出口配额，官方称
item.description: 巴西农业部贸易秘书路易斯·鲁阿周三接受采访时表示，巴西政府可能为向中国销售产品的国内牛肉企业分配单独的出口配额。【原文：The Brazilian government may assign individual export quotas for domestic beef companies selling products to China, Luis Rua, trade secretary at Brazil's ministry of agriculture, said in an interview on Wednesday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚南32集团上半年利润增长16%
item.description: 澳大利亚多元化矿业公司South32周四公布，受大宗商品价格上涨推动，其上半年利润增长16%。【原文：Australian diversified miner South32 reported a 16% rise in its first-half profit on Thursday, boosted by higher commodity prices.】

item.title: Equinix预测年度销售额将因人工智能数据中心需求超出预期
item.description: Equinix周三发布年度营收预期，其预测数值高于市场预期。这家全球最大数据中心运营商押注人工智能相关服务需求强劲，推动其股价在盘后交易中上涨逾6%。【原文：Equinix forecast annual revenue above estimates on Wednesday, betting on strong artificial intelligence-linked demand for the largest data center operator's services, sending its shares up over 6% in extended trading.】

item.title: 米兰表示他非常希望继续留在美联储任职，但最终决定权在他人手中。
item.description: 美联储理事斯蒂芬·米兰周三表示，如果被要求，他将"非常乐意"长期留任央行，但决定权不在他手中。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Stephen Miran on Wednesday said he would be "very happy" to stay on at the central bank longer-term if asked, but the decision is not up to him.】

item.title: 阿尔巴马尔因凯特詹资产出售相关费用转为季度亏损
item.description: 全球最大锂生产商阿尔巴马尔公司周三表示，其季度业绩出现亏损，主要原因是即将出售凯捷炼油催化剂业务所产生的相关费用。【原文：Albemarle , the world's largest producer of lithium, said on Wednesday it swung to a quarterly loss largely due to charges tied to the upcoming sale of its Ketjen refining catalyst business.】

item.title: 人类将承担部分成本，因数据中心扩张可能推高电费账单
item.description: 人工智能公司Anthropic周三宣布了一系列举措，旨在限制数据中心对消费者能源价格的影响。这些举措出台之际，人工智能技术所需的高能耗基础设施正获得更多投资。【原文：Artificial intelligence company Anthropic on Wednesday announced initiatives to limit the impact of data centers on consumer energy prices amid increased investment in power-hungry infrastructure necessary for AI tech.】

item.title: 思科上调全年业绩预期，人工智能需求推动增长
item.description: 思科系统公司周三上调了全年营收和调整后利润预期，主要得益于人工智能热潮推动企业对其网络设备的大量投资。【原文：Cisco Systems raised its full-year revenue and adjusted profit forecasts on Wednesday, driven by robust enterprise spending on its networking equipment amid the artificial intelligence boom.】

item.title: 麦当劳季度全球销售额超预期，超值套餐策略奏效
item.description: 周三公布的数据显示，麦当劳第四季度全球同店销售额和利润超出华尔街预期。套餐优惠和强劲的营销活动吸引了预算紧张的美国消费者，而澳大利亚和英国市场需求依然坚挺。【原文：McDonald's topped Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter global comparable sales and profit on Wednesday, as meal deals and strong marketing promotions pulled in budget-strapped U.S. diners and demand held firm in Australia and Britain.】

item.title: 澳新银行集团第一季度现金利润跃升17%，得益于成本降低
item.description: 澳新银行集团周四表示，其第一季度现金利润较2025财年下半年季度平均值（不计重大项目）增长17%，主要得益于成本降低、收入增长以及更高现金股本回报率。【原文：ANZ Group said on Thursday its first-quarter cash profit rose 17% from the second-half FY25 quarterly average excluding significant items, due to lower costs, firmer revenue and higher cash returns on equity.】

item.title: 马斯克表示xAI已进行重组，导致部分员工被裁员。
item.description: 埃隆·马斯克周三表示，随着人工智能公司xAI的扩张，该公司已裁减部分员工，这是旨在提高效率的更广泛重组计划的一部分。【原文：Elon Musk said on Wednesday that xAI has laid off some employees as part of a broader reorganization aimed at improving efficiency as the artificial intelligence firm expands.】

item.title: 阿克曼的对冲基金派生广场押注Meta，退出希尔顿
item.description: 亿万富翁投资者比尔·阿克曼周三向客户透露，其对冲基金去年底买入了Meta Platforms的股票，押注这家科技巨头将受益于人工智能的发展。【原文：Billionaire investor Bill Ackman told clients on Wednesday that his hedge fund bought shares in Meta Platforms late last year, betting the technology giant will benefit from artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 诺斯罗普·格鲁曼公司与波兰军工企业计划在波兰实现年产18万余枚炮弹的目标
item.description: 美国国防供应商诺斯罗普·格鲁曼公司波兰区总经理周三表示，该公司与波兰军工集团Niewiadow-PGM计划在波兰实现年产18万余枚炮弹的目标。【原文：U.S. defence supplier Northrop Grumman and Polish arms group Niewiadow-PGM aim to make more than 180,000 artillery shells annually in Poland, Northrop Grumman's managing director for Poland said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，巴西审计法院认定央行在Banco Master银行清算过程中无过失
item.description: 巴西联邦审计法院（TCU）已完成对央行处理Banco Master清算事宜的技术审查，并确认监管机构的行为不存在任何保留意见或建议，一位知情人士透露。【原文：Brazil's federal audit court TCU has completed a technical review of the central bank's handling of Banco Master's liquidation and found no reservations or recommendations regarding the regulator's conduct, a source familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 备忘录称美联储将审查此前指出的银行缺陷
item.description: 据路透社获得的一份发给员工的备忘录显示，随着美国央行对其国内金融机构的监管体系进行全面改革，美联储计划重新审查此前监管人员要求银行解决的问题。【原文：The Federal Reserve plans to review issues its examiners had previously flagged for banks to address, as the U.S. central bank overhauls its oversight of the nation's financial institutions, according to a memo sent to staff and seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 美国1月预算赤字降至950亿美元，因财政收入增幅超过支出增长
item.description: 美国财政部周三表示，1月份美国政府预算赤字为950亿美元，较上年同期减少340亿美元，降幅达26%，原因是包括关税在内的收入增长超过了支出增幅。【原文：The U.S. government posted a $95 billion budget deficit in January, down $34 billion or 26% from a year earlier as revenue gains including customs duties outpaced growth in outlays, the Treasury Department said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国众议院中国事务委员会首席民主党议员对英伟达H200销售持开放态度
item.description: 美国众议院负责中国事务的委员会首席民主党议员周一表示，他愿意考虑向中国出售英伟达上一代"霍珀"芯片，这与他前任的立场有所不同。【原文：The top Democrat on a U.S. House of Representatives committee focused on China on Monday signaled that he is open to the sale of the older Nvidia generation of "Hopper" chips to China, a change from his predecessor's position.】

item.title: 加拿大央行决策者认为美联储独立性面临的威胁加剧了全球动荡
item.description: 加拿大银行理事会成员在周三发布的1月会议讨论摘要中表示，美国联邦储备委员会独立性面临的威胁加剧了全球动荡与不确定性。【原文：The Bank of Canada's Governing Council members said threats to the independence of the U.S. Federal Reserve had added to the turbulence and uncertainty in the world, according to the summary of deliberations at their January meeting released on Wednesday.】

item.title: 希尔顿预测2026年客房收入增长低于预期，因经济型旅游需求疲软
item.description: 希尔顿全球控股公司周三预测，2026年客房收入增长将低于华尔街预期，这反映出注重预算的旅客降低了消费支出，尽管高端旅行需求强劲助其超出第四季度盈利预期。【原文：Hilton Worldwide Holdings on Wednesday forecast 2026 room revenue growth below Wall Street expectations, reflecting lowered spending by budget-conscious travelers, even as strong demand for premium travel helped it beat fourth-quarter profit estimates.】

item.title: SOLV Energy在纳斯达克强势上市，估值达60亿美元
item.description: SOLV Energy周三在纽约上市首日股价大涨20%，这家太阳能与电池储能企业的估值达到59.8亿美元，凸显2026年首次公开募股活动强劲复苏。【原文：SOLV Energy's shares rose 20% in its New York debut on Wednesday, giving the solar and battery storage firm a valuation of $5.98 billion, underscoring a strong rebound in IPO activity in 2026.】

item.title: 加密货币借贷平台BlockFills因比特币价格持续走低暂停提款服务
item.description: 加密货币流动性提供商兼贷款机构BlockFills在比特币价格下跌期间暂停了客户的存款和取款业务，这表明最新一轮加密货币市场下跌已产生连锁反应。【原文：Crypto liquidity provider and lender BlockFills has halted client deposits and withdrawals amid a downturn in bitcoin prices, in a sign of knock-on impact from the latest crypto market drop.】

item.title: Meta启动100亿美元印第安纳数据中心建设以提升人工智能能力
item.description: Meta周三宣布，将在印第安纳州破土动工建设一座耗资100亿美元的数据中心，以竞速获取支撑其人工智能雄心的海量计算能力。【原文：Meta said on Wednesday that it was breaking ground on a $10 billion data center in Indiana, as it races to secure the massive amounts of computing power needed to support its artificial intelligence ambitions.】

item.title: 未参与特朗普药品定价协议的制药公司寻求突破口
item.description: 据六位行业消息人士透露，部分未被特朗普总统点名要求降低美国药品价格的制药公司正着手制定自己的协议，试图规避可能面临的重关税和新的定价机制。【原文：Some pharmaceutical companies not targeted by President Donald Trump for agreements to lower their U.S. drug pricing are looking to craft their own deals in an attempt to avoid potentially onerous tariffs and new price-setting schemes, according to six industry sources.】

item.title: 投资者称特朗普撤销温室气体政策将引发混乱，可能增加成本
item.description: 股东权益倡导者和投资组合经理表示，特朗普政府推翻奥巴马时期支撑温室气体法规的法律分析的决定，将给企业和投资者都带来混乱和额外成本。【原文：The Trump administration's decision to overturn an Obama-era legal analysis underpinning greenhouse gas rules will sow confusion and add costs for businesses and investors alike, shareholder advocates and portfolio managers say.】

item.title: 英国最高法院关于专利与人工智能的裁决将推动创新，律师表示
item.description: 英国最高法院周三裁定，人工神经网络——一种能够进行机器学习的人工智能——可以获得专利。律师们对此判决表示欢迎，认为这将推动人工智能创新的专利申请。【原文：An artificial neural network, a type of artificial intelligence which can engage in machine learning, can be patented, the United Kingdom's Supreme Court ruled on Wednesday in a decision welcomed by lawyers as a boost for patenting AI innovations.】

item.title: 据彭博社报道，贝克休斯正考虑以15亿美元出售旗下韦盖特业务部门。
item.description: 据彭博社周三报道，知情人士透露，油田服务供应商贝克休斯正考虑以15亿美元的价格出售旗下韦盖特技术公司。【原文：Oilfield services provider Baker Hughes is exploring a potential $1.5 billion sale of its Waygate Technologies unit, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, citing people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 美国企业面临收入鸿沟扩大，富人消费不减而预算购物者举步维艰
item.description: 美国消费经济正呈现双向拉扯态势，高管层的评论中日益凸显的鸿沟昭然若揭：高端品牌从富裕消费者身上获利，而注重性价比的企业则面临手头拮据的家庭消费收紧的困境。【原文：America's consumer economy is pulling in opposite directions, a gulf increasingly apparent in C-suite commentary, with premium brands profiting from well-off customers while value-focused firms battle restraint from cash-strapped households.】
